meanings.sent1: The preexisting tree provided shade for the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The doctor asked about any preexisting medical conditions.
meanings.sent3: The preexisting rule about no running in the hallway was broken by the energetic puppy.
meanings.sent4: Her preexisting love for music made her a natural at playing the piano.
meanings.sent5: The preexisting friendship between the two neighbors made their bond unbreakable.

meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before something else
meanings.sent1: The preexisting agreement was already in place before the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The preexisting damage to the car made it difficult to sell.
meanings.sent3: The preexisting plan to go to the beach was ruined by the sudden rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: His preexisting knowledge of the topic helped him excel in the class.
meanings.sent5: The preexisting tension in the room was palpable as they waited for the results.
